Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi homered twice and drove in four runs.
The Chicago White Sox beat the Los Angeles Angels 8-4.
The White Sox achieved their first three-game winning streak in nearly three months.
Andrew Vaughn drove a fastball over the wall in left-center.
Lenyn Sosa hit a homer to lead off the third inning.
Rookie Jonathan Cannon went 6 2/3 innings, tying a season-high with seven strikeouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore praised Andrew Benintendi's performance.
Andrew Vaughn emphasized the team's focus on playing their best baseball every day.
Ron Washington reflected on Reid Detmers' struggles during the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox are trying to avoid the post-1900 record of 120 losses by the 1962 expansion New York Mets.
The Angels have dropped six straight games.
Los Angeles reached its 90th loss in its 150th game, the quickest in franchise history.
The Angels are trying to avoid having the most losses in franchise history in Ron Washington’s first year as manager.
Others: White Sox 3B Yoán Moncada was activated off the 60-day injured list.
Angels CF Mike Trout mentioned considering a position change next season.
Several Angels players were not in the lineup due to injuries.
